form.autoReapplyDescription: After re-applying an auto-discovered certificate, the certificate will be written back to the original folder. Domain and folder name cannot be modified.
form.manualApplyReapplyDescription: Manually applied certificates can be re-applied, and all fields can be modified.
form.manualAddReapplyDescription: After re-applying a manually added certificate, only the certificate content and private key content will be updated. All fields are read-only. To modify, please click the Edit button.
form.folderNameHelp: Unique identifier, can only contain letters, numbers, underscores, and hyphens
form.sansPlaceholder:
One domain per line, e.g.:
www.example.com
api.example.com
form.sansHelp: Enter one domain per line, leave empty to apply for main domain only
form.webrootHelp: Web root directory path for HTTP-01 verification, leave empty to use default path
form.forceRenewalHelp: When enabled, will force re-apply certificate (even if not expired). When disabled, will use cached certificate if available.
form.rateLimitInfo: Let's Encrypt limit: A maximum of 5 certificates can be issued for the same set of identifiers within 168 hours (7 days). If force renewal is enabled, the certificate will be re-applied even if not expired, which may trigger rate limits.

reapply.confirmMessage:
Are you sure you want to re-apply certificate "{{domain}}"?

Will use cached certificate if available.
reapply.confirmMessageForce:
Are you sure you want to force re-apply certificate "{{domain}}"?

Note: Force renewal will ignore cache and re-apply even if certificate is not expired, which may trigger Let's Encrypt rate limits.
